Haxe Roundup 526

by Skial Bainn edited on Thursday, April 23rd, 2020
Submit a link Edit

Welcome to the latest edition of the Haxe Roundup. Haxe is a high level, strictly typed programming language and cross-compiler.

Community Updates

News and Articles

  • Village Generator 1.1.0 devlog. Waterbodies and PNG export have been added by Oleg Dolya.
  • A little trip through dependencies and accompanying difficulties by Nikolay Grebenshikov.
  • Version 1.0.0 of Scales: A Pangolin Story by Hello Lightbulb is out! And its source code available too!
In case you missed it
  • Formatter 1.10.1 has been released.
  • HaxeFlixel have just launched snippets.haxeflixel.com a beginner friendly resource for learning HaxeFlixel!
  • RPG Playground games are now playable on mobile! So grab your phone or tablet and start playing the top games at rpgplayground/popular!
  • RPG Map Editor 2 Update 16 - The huge one by S√©bastien B√©nard.
  • Oleg Dolya has created Village Generator which is made with Haxe and OpenFL.

  • Nightly builds of HIDE are now available!

Product Releases & Announcements

  • Ratalaika has finished his first port of the Stencyl game and sent it to QA for PS4, Xbox One and Nintendo Switch! Hopefully it will be released in a few weeks. So if you have a Stencyl game and want to port it to consoles let them know!

Open Source

  • Check out Gauthier Billot‚Äôs new interactive website! With a fully functional OS! Made in Haxe
  • HaxeFlixel game jam repository template has been released, the best part, automated deployment of HTML5 builds to GitHub Pages!
  • 2D vector generated die, (no textures), demo by Nanjizal.
  • Ilya Kuzmichev has made quick and dirty build of Haxe Support plugin for support for new IntelliJ IDEA 2020.1.
  • Small update for HxDoom being made in Haxe and Lime, Kaelan Evans has reduced memory usage from 300mb to about 80mb.
  • Jonas Nystr√∂m has updated HxTrueType.
  • haxe-strings v6.0.1 has been released.
  • Haxe-concurrent v3.0.0 has been released.
  • Colyseus-hx v0.13.0 has been released.
  • Aseprite files as OpenFL sprites.
  • Couple of tweets from Ian Harrigan about HaxeUI:

Closed Source

  • Stage select code complete from WIP turn based puzzle game by mauve.
  • Luyren has added parallax camera movement to their Utility Pack, and also added an HTML5 showcase game for both that and the Map System pack.
  • Austin East redid his networking project to replace socket.io with colyseus. Check out this gif that is showing the client-side interpolation system he wrote.
  • Moving spikes are fun by Andrej.
  • Pavel Alexandrov is working on plugin for HIDE, the Heaps IDE. Here are couple of screenshots, tile coords editor and Photoshop-like outline shader.
  • Praelian is working on the boss encounter with HaxeFlixel.
  • A bunch of new quick videos from WIP Stencyl based game by Ben Simms with more at his Twitter:
    • A quick video demoing the mechanics and the art.
    • A little introduction level.
    • Ability to flip gravity.
    • 3rd power - Pausing time!
    • Added the ability to speed up time.

People & Projects to support

  • Alexander Gordeyko is developing Pony, a Haxe open-cross-library.
  • Andy Li is working around the Haxe ecosystem: CI, packaging, docs and learning materials.
  • Kevin Leung is creating open source software libraries.
  • Robert Konrad, the Kha author, is creating Programming Toolkits.
  • Lubos & contributors are creating Armory, an open source 3D game engine in Blender.
  • OpenFL is creating free open source software.
  • HaxeUI is creating an open source user interface libraries.
  • HaxeFlixel is creating an open source, cross platform 2D game engine.
  • Slava Ra is creating improvements for FlashDevelop and HaxeDevelop.
  • Mark Knol is working on Haxe and its documentation.
  • Dan Korostelev is working on the Haxe compiler.
  • Eric Bishton is creating the Haxe plugin for IntelliJ IDEA.
  • Will Blanton is creating HaxeFlixel tutorials.
  • Matthew Wallace is creating Haxe By Example tutorials.
  • August Late is creating unique 2D lighting tech.

Updates from the Haxe core

Current Proposals & Discussions

  • Add Default implementations in interfaces proposal.
  • Add Abstract classes proposal.
  • Add ReadOnlyArray optimisation proposal.
  • Carry comments through to target language proposal.
  • Add support for on site getters & setters proposal.
  • Add support for Self access for abstracts proposal.
  • [RFC] Xml Dsl‚Äôs discussion.
  • Add support for default type parameters proposal.
  • Add polymorphic this types proposal.
  • Add Type parameter variance for Enums.
  • Add Default values for enum parameters.
  • Do you have an idea to improve Haxe? Consider creating a proposal.

Core Changes

30~ commits have been made to Haxe compiler in the last week.

  • Large file support discussion.
In case you missed it
  • Less local variable renaming in compiled code merged.
  • Use native PHP implementations for SHA merged.
  • Weird tempvaring issue.
  • Better error reporting upon compiler crashes merged.
  • Find references of the base field or include descendant fields pull request.

You can get started using the latest features by downloading a nightly build of Haxe and see the impact the latest changes have on each target by browsing the benchmarks site.

Take it easy everyone, stay safe and have a good week!
